intro: Catabrosa elbursensis, commonly known as the Elburs catabrosa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Elburs Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
